intro: Struthanthus phillyreoides, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has small, oval leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces a capsule-like fruit that contains numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Struthanthus phillyreoides is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats.
